ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Bystander Scenario - Indicate when you would feel uncomfortable (options 1 -35)
Notes: 1=It's Friday night; 2=You were hoping to go out with your roommate, but they have a date tonight; 3=You really want to go out, so you text the group chat to see what's going on; 4=You take a couple shots with your roommate and get dressed to go out while you wait to hear back from your friends; 5=Your friend mentions a party your classmate is throwing; 6=You don't know the classmate very well, but all your friends say they're going and since there's nothing else going on you decide to go, too; 7=You text your friend for the address and say you'll meet them at the party; 8=You and your roommate take one more shot as you wait for your rideshare to pick you up; 9=When you first arrive, you look around the packed room for your friend; 10=You check your phone and see a text saying they will be there in a few; 11=You consider waiting outside until they get there but since it's raining you decide to stay inside and wait for your friends; 12=You head to the kitchen to grab some beer while you're waiting; 13=Once you've filled your cup, you walk over to the living room; 14=You see people dancing to that song that has been stuck in your head all week, and you notice your classmates Taylor and Alex are sitting over in the corner; 15=Phew, now you don't have to stand around awkwardly; 16=Taylor is smiling from ear-to-ear chatting with Alex in the corner; 17=Alex spills a drink on themselves and looks pretty out of it; 18=Taylor grabs a napkin and starts to wipe the drink off Alex; 19=Taylor's hand slides down to Alex's leg and lingers for a moment too long; 20=Alex pushes away Taylor's hand with a flirty laugh; 21=Of course, Taylor is always looking for the next hook up; 22=You head over to say hi; 23=Taylor sees you and says, ''Hey, you look like you need a shot''; 24=You agree and take Taylor up on the offer; 25=Before grabbing your drink, Taylor looks back at Alex and asks if Alex is drunk yet, which you think is weird because Alex's eyes are glossed over; 26=Taylor whispers something in Alex's ear; 27=Alex, stumbling over their words says, ''No thanks, I'm good''; 28=Taylor replies, amused, ''Are you sure?'' Taylor gestures around at the party with a cup. ''Have a little fun! What can I get you?''; 29=Alex responds, ''No really, I've had too much''; 30=Taylor goes to grab your shots and you chat a bit with Alex; 31=Alex mentions wanting to go back to their dorm; 32=You pull out your phone and see you missed a message from your friends on the group chat; 33=Your friends said they heard about a better party and asked if you wanted to meet there instead; 34=You look around and decide that another party would probably be better, so you agree; 35=They text you the address and it's right next to Alex's dorm
